summary: Machine Learning and Vision Transformers for Thyroid Carcinoma Diagnosis: A review explores how AI-based approaches, especially those using transformers, are improving TC diagnosis and determining malignancy risks. The article categorizes these methods based on AI algorithms, goals, and computing environments, and compares available TC datasets.
text:
In a groundbreaking review article, researchers delve into the exciting world of smart diagnostic systems for thyroid carcinoma (TC) using machine learning (ML) and big data analysis. The study highlights the crucial role transformers play in evaluating TC prognosis and determining malignancy risk.

The authors present a new categorization system for AI-based methods, which include supervised, unsupervised, or mixed approaches. These categories depend on the specific AI algorithms used, the objectives of the frameworks, and their computing environments.

Additionally, the review examines existing TC datasets, comparing them based on key features that are essential for accurate diagnosis and risk assessment. The authors emphasize the importance of AI instruments in diagnosing and treating TC, with transformers continuing to be a vital component in medical diagnostics and disease management.

However, despite the progress made in this field, challenges still exist. Researchers must address ongoing issues to ensure the continued development and success of these innovative systems.

The review also sheds light on future directions within TC diagnosis research, with machine learning and vision transformers paving the way for a brighter, more accurate medical diagnostic landscape.
title: Revolutionizing Thyroid Carcinoma Diagnosis: Machine Learning and Vision Transformers Leading the Way
creator: Yassine Habchi, Hamza Kheddar, Yassine Himeur, Abdelkrim Boukabou, Ammar Chouchane, Abdelmalik Ouamane, Shadi Atalla, Wathiq Mansoor
